meanings.definition: The possession of property by lease or payment of rent.
meanings.sent1: Her tenancy of the apartment was secured through a signed lease agreement.
meanings.sent2: During the tenancy, the tenant is responsible for paying rent to the landlord.
meanings.sent3: The tenancy of the house next door changed hands after the previous tenant decided to move to a different city.
meanings.sent4: In the world of renting, the concept of tenancy is like a dance between the landlord and the tenant.
meanings.sent5: The tenancy of the office space was short-lived as the company decided to relocate to a larger building.

meanings.definition: The period of time during which one occupies a property as a tenant.
meanings.sent1: His tenancy in the house lasted for two years before he decided to move out.
meanings.sent2: The tenancy of the apartment will end next month when the lease expires.
meanings.sent3: During her tenancy in the beach house, she enjoyed the sound of the waves every morning.
meanings.sent4: The tenancy of the old bookstore felt like stepping into a different era.
meanings.sent5: The tenancy of the cabin in the woods was a peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of the city.
